verses.text: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Set thine house in order : for thou shalt die , and not live.\f + \fr 38.1 \ft Set…: Heb. Give charge concerning thy house\f*
Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall , and prayed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*,

And said , Remember now, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart , and have done \add that which is\add* good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.\f + \fr 38.3 \ft sore: Heb. with great weeping\f* \p
¶ Then came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to Isaiah , saying ,

Go , and say to Hezekiah , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of David thy father , I have heard thy prayer , I have seen thy tears : behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria : and I will defend this city.

And this \add shall be\add* a sign unto thee from the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will do this thing that he hath spoken ;

Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees , which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz , ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees , by which degrees it was gone down.\f + \fr 38.8 \ft sun dial: Heb. degrees by, or, with the sun\f* \p
¶ The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah , when he had been sick , and was recovered of his sickness :
I said in the cutting off of my days , I shall go to the gates of the grave : I am deprived of the residue of my years.

I said , I shall not see the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3050"\+w*
d*, \add even\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3050"\+w*
d*, in the land of the living : I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

Mine age is departed , and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent : I have cut off like a weaver my life : he will cut me off with pining sickness : from day \add even\add* to night wilt thou make an end of me.\f + \fr 38.12 \ft with…: or, from the thrum\f*
I reckoned till morning , \add that\add*, as a lion , so will he break all my bones : from day \add even\add* to night wilt thou make an end of me.

Like a crane \add or\add* a swallow , so did I chatter : I did mourn as a dove : mine eyes fail \add with looking\add* upward : O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I am oppressed ; undertake for me.\f + \fr 38.14 \ft undertake…: or, ease me\f*
What shall I say ? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done \add it:\add* I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
O Lord , by these \add things men\add* live , and in all these \add things is\add* the life of my spirit : so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.

Behold, for peace I had great bitterness : but thou hast in love to my soul \add delivered it\add* from the pit of corruption : for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.\f + \fr 38.17 \ft for peace…: or, on my peace came great bitterness\f*\f + \fr 38.17 \ft thou hast in…: Heb. thou hast loved my soul from the pit\f*
For the grave cannot praise thee, death can \add not\add* celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.
The living , the living , he shall praise thee, as I \add do\add* this day : the father to the children shall make known thy truth.

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add was ready\add* to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
For Isaiah had said , Let them take a lump of figs , and lay \add it\add* for a plaister upon the boil , and he shall recover.
Hezekiah also had said , What \add is\add* the sign that I shall go up to the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?
